alert.note: Alert for Dragoon, Mule, Huachuca and Santa Rita Mountains including Bisbee, Canelo Hills, Madera Canyon; Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox; Upper San Pedro River Valley including Sierra Vista, Benson (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 3:12PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A group of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Pima and southwestern Cochise Counties through 415 PM MST... At 310 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking an area of strong thunderstorms from just west of Tombstone south to just west of Bisbee. These storms are moving slowly to the west. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sierra Vista, Bisbee, Hereford, Whetstone, Huachuca City, St. David, Tombstone, Naco, Kartchner Caverns State Park, Fort Huachuca, Palominas, Charleston, Fairbank, Coronado National Memorial and Ramsey Canyon Preserve. This includes the following highways... Route 80 between mile markers 299 and 342. Route 82 between mile markers 47 and 67. Route 90 between mile markers 294 and 336. Route 92 between mile markers 322 and 355. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Local heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
